Nicolo \"Nico\" Toscani.Action: Shown as a child studying martial arts diligently, progressing to winning trophies and becoming an instructor after training with real masters in Japan.
Portrayed with military uniforms and security clearance documents, indicating trust and skill recognized by authorities.
Feels instant animosity toward Kurt Zagon upon meeting him.
Leads the group confidently and nimbly through the jungle, showing he is at home and physically capable.
Responds to Zagon's question in a straightforward, factual manner about their location.
Leads the group confidently down an unmarked, twisting jungle trail, showing athleticism and ease in the environment; displays leadership by taking point.
Immediately senses animosity toward Kurt Zagon and questions his legitimacy and the group’s association, indicating situational awareness and discernment.
Maintains composure in uncertain situations, balancing between uneasiness and humor upon arrival of the chemical interrogation team.
Indicates cigarette glow to suggest lighting a bonfire, showing situational awareness and tactical thinking.
Leads the party through the perimeter of the base camp confidently, demonstrating leadership and knowledge of the situation.
Moves stealthily around defensive positions, checking the perimeter and speaking in dialect to roust lookouts, showing skill and resourcefulness.
Expresses distrust of the base camp troops openly, displaying good judgment about unreliable allies.
Seems uneasy about what might happen inside the hooch, showing emotional response but no direct action taken.
Enters the scene quickly and takes in the chaotic and violent situation immediately, positioning himself strategically near the entrance.
Does not intervene directly or display any immediate attempt to control or de-escalate the situation despite being present and seemingly aware of the torture.
Watches impassively as Zagon threatens and assaults the prisoner.
Has difficulty containing his emotion witnessing the prisoner’s suffering.
Watches impassively as Zagon tortures the prisoner, showing difficulty containing his emotion but does not intervene.
Refuses to shoot to avoid escalating violence despite fear and rage.
Turns and runs away to safety on Fox's urging, showing trust and acknowledgement of teamwork.
Grabs his son with a theatrical protective motion, kisses him on the bare butt, holds him high and proud, puts arm around Sara.
Tries awkwardly to deal with his son's pooping problem, humorously acknowledges it in front of relatives.
Makes a teasing comment: "That's what you get for not marrying a Sicilian."
Hosts a family gathering with warm interactions among relatives and guests.
Lukich jokes about Toscani's many relatives under indictment, indicating a rough reputation but no direct negative personal action.
Has numerous relatives under federal indictment, suggesting a complicated or potentially compromised background.
Maintains a social gathering with many guests, including other police officers and family, showing social skill and confidence.
Is described by others (Luigi) as approachable by an undercover cop who could easily arrest him, hinting at vulnerability or lack of streetwise competence.
Shakes hands with Dr. Watanabe with real pleasure, greets her warmly and speaks Japanese with her like old friends.
Teases Jackson about finding the right partner in a playful, friendly manner.
Responds kindly and appreciatively to Branca's affectionate pat and compliments.
Comforts Mrs. Zingaro, holds her, speaks reassuringly, promises to help and return later.
Kisses Mrs. Zingaro and takes Sara's hand in goodbye.
Nods and thanks guests at his son's baptism, taking farewells politely.
Mentions 'Broken windows and lost kittens' in context of police work, showing concern for community.
Recognizes the troubled situation with the kid from the bar and comforts Mrs. Zingaro, reassuring her of a plan to handle it.
Takes responsibility by promising to come by again and find a way to take care of the problem, showing follow-through and commitment.
Balances personal life (baptism festivities) with professional duties efficiently, moving from one to the other without hesitation.
Acts as a confident and reassuring figure, taking charge and signaling capability to those around him.
Enters a hostile bar to inquire about a missing girl, staying calm despite rude treatment.
Tries to engage tough bar patrons politely, using humor in response to their mockery.
Shows persistence and concern in searching for a missing girl, despite personal discomfort and lack of welcome.
Enters a dangerous bar in inappropriate attire yet attempts to interact confidently and persuasively by showing a photo and addressing tough-looking suspects.
Faces hostility and mockery from bar patrons and does not escalate conflict, showing restraint and focus.
Persists in questioning despite being ignored and derided, maintaining composure.
His silk shirt and sport coat clash with the environment, potentially compromising his effectiveness by appearing out of place.
Engages in violent, aggressive behavior, provoking others and showing rage.
Drags the Pimp violently, threatens to throw him down the stairs, physically assaults him.
Protects Lucy, rescues her from the Pimp, shows reluctance to inflict too much harm to avoid causing more tragedy for her.
Considers the Pimp's information but remains skeptical, showing critical judgment by tightening his grip when the Pimp lies.
Emerges bloodied and wild-haired from a risky situation, successfully rescuing Lucy, showing physical courage and protective instincts.
Decides not to bring Lucy back to her grandmother in her current state, choosing to get her clothes and a bath first, showing thoughtful and practical care.
Walks a tearful, contrite Lucy inside the bakery to her grandparents, who thank him emotionally.
Explains to Jackson his reasons for staying a cop despite cynicism, expressing desire to make a positive difference in his own neighborhood.
Shows clear self-awareness and realistic assessment of his limitations and the systemic obstacles he faces as a cop.
Expresses a determined, focused motivation to make a tangible difference in his own community despite knowing he can't change the world.
Carries himself with an air of class and education yet embraces a gritty 'wild man' approach, indicating versatility in behavior and style.
Does not respond immediately to Jackson’s questioning; pauses and considers before speaking, implying thoughtfulness and control.
Refers to himself with a self-deprecating nickname 'shitheel cop' which might imply some self-doubt or insecurity about his role.
Offers a heart-shaped box of chocolates to Carla, attempting a friendly gesture despite her hostility.
Grabs Carla by the elbow and heaves her back into the lockup among other detainees despite her resistance and anger.
Responds to Jackson’s reprimand about respect with a dismissive 'Take it easy, sister' and walks away.
Jokes mildly about busting the lawyer for being a lousy lay.
Follows Abandano discreetly and professionally with partner, signaling to follow quietly.
Opens cab door, flips badge, and politely asks occupant to leave to further investigation.
Keeps focused and works closely with partner during stakeout without complaint or frustration.
Follows Abandano and the woman into the bank and then tails them outside, demonstrating proactive surveillance skills.
Opens a cab door, flashes badge confidently, and removes occupant to follow the target, showing decisiveness and authority.
Senses something amid the crowd of protestors when Jackson is indifferent or frustrated, indicating alertness and intuition.
Finds the pimp with Lucy, demonstrating awareness and concern for her situation.
Connects a small transmitter hastily but effectively to the phone line to intercept communications.
Uses earphones and a tape recorder in an unmarked car to covertly listen and record sensitive information.
Immediately recognizes importance of intercepted information and writes down shipment details accurately.
Prioritizes obtaining evidence over concerns about legal consequences, showing practical focus but possible recklessness.
Dismisses Jackson's concerns about protection and legal risks, indicating some disregard for caution and team input.
Makes a derogatory comment about the suspect (wants to know when he wipes his behind).
Grabs the barmaid's waist, pulls her onto the dance floor, and does a playful twirl to cheer up Jackson.
Assures Salvano about the engine block delivery date confidently.
Lightheartedly distracts Jackson by pulling barmaid onto dance floor and promising to make Jackson famous.
Engages in undercover disguise as a meat processor skillfully and confidently alongside allies.
Sarcastically mocks fellow officers and uses aggressive language to claim the channel: 'This is our channel, dickhead.'
Light-heartedly teases Lukich about his appearance: 'You're too ugly...'
Wears hidden microphones and confidently communicates over radio, asserting control of the channel.
Maintains situational awareness by observing suspicious vehicles and people cautiously.
Engages in sarcastic banter with colleagues during a boring stakeout.
Calls out Lukich as 'too ugly' in a casual, possibly teasing manner.
Directs Jackson to stay put to keep him safe during a dangerous situation.
Coordinates a tactical operation by directing Jackson to hold position, remaining aware of safe distances.
Leads a stealthy approach by ditching rakes and sprinting in a crouch through dangerous environments in the packing plant.
Maintains communication under pressure by using a hidden mike to update his team and command action quickly.
Emerges with guns drawn to confront adversaries despite heavy fire and chaos, indicating confidence and skill in a high-stress shootout.
Steps in front of an accelerating Lincoln and puts himself in danger to stop it, risking his life.
Grabs Salvano by the throat aggressively, potentially harming him severely.
Leaps off the roof pulling Salvano past broken glass to get him out of danger.
Drags Salvano roughly by the neck and slams him against the van.
Climbs into the van and tears off the wood slats while others care for the wounded.
Sniffs an explosive device with confusion and frustration, showing concern for unexpected danger.
Maintains a bitter, fuming expression despite compliments, showing frustration but also engagement and emotional investment in the work.
Receives a reprimand or underappreciation from a superior while being recognized for initiative and gallantry.
Challenges authority and demands answers about criminal justice, expressing outrage on behalf of officers risking their lives.
Uses biting sarcasm toward Agent Neeley during a tense exchange.
Stifles outrage despite being furious and upset, showing control in a difficult situation.
Challenges the FBI's explanation with biting sarcasm and pointed questions, showing engagement and critical thinking.
Stifles outrage despite evident fury, maintaining professional composure under stress.
Shows visible frustration and anger that threatens to undermine calm, indicating difficulty controlling emotions.
Reluctantly hands over tapes and bugging devices despite personal risk, acknowledging consequences for himself and partner.
Mocks the tape collection lightly amidst serious situation.
Shows visible devastation at order to stand down, indicating emotional investment and care.
Reluctantly hands over tapes and bugging devices despite personal risk and frustration, showing awareness of legal consequences.
Mocks the request by joking about the tapes being his 'Lawrence Welk collection,' demonstrating dry wit under pressure.
Continues to push the investigation aggressively despite being ordered to stand down, showing determination but risking procedural rules.
Possesses and uses illegal surveillance equipment, putting himself and his partner at legal risk.
Suggests going to Salvano's for lunch after a stressful case, agrees to do something normal for Jackson's sake.
Keeps a taped phone conversation, listens attentively and shares the moment with Jackson.
Makes a lighthearted, sarcastic comment about married couples still in love while tailing suspects.
Observes the church where his son was baptized and comments to Jackson about his mother’s relation to the place.
Stops Jackson to stay and look around the church courtyard despite the urgency of the situation

Engages easily and warmly with Father Genarro, maintaining a confident and personable demeanor.

Asks questions about the refugees and the break-in, indicating concern and interest.
Asks relevant and timely questions about the break-in and the refugees' situation, showing alertness and engagement.
Observes the physical signs of a break-in (broken door handle) and connects this to his inquiry, indicating situational awareness.
Engages respectfully with other characters (Father Genarro and Father Tomassino), signaling social competence and professionalism.
Does not immediately intervene or escalate when faced with the broken door and possible danger, instead gathering information calmly.

Responds to Father Genarro's suggestion about confession with confident dismissal, indicating self-assurance albeit potentially dismissive.
Engages positively with the community, exchanging pleasantries in multiple languages, showing social skill and cultural competence.
Sings with full gusto alongside his wife and mother in church, attempts to comfort crying baby Julian.
Looks toward the priest and notices suspicious woman leaving a bag in church, but takes no immediate action.
Instantly pushes his family to the floor, covering them with his body to protect them from an explosion.

Presses aggressively with Agent Neeley, ignoring professional boundaries and showing confrontational behavior.

Confronts Agent Neeley assertively and insists on accountability, showing initiative.

Eyes the guy dubiously and prepares for self-defense when asked for a light, showing distrust.
In a life-threatening situation, uses his combat skills to disarm and incapacitate attackers but does not use excessive violence beyond what is necessary.
Seizes Machete Man's wrist and wrenches away his machete while protecting himself from Gun Man, then injures Gun Man effectively.
Flips Machete Man who has Nico's gun, rendering him half-unconscious.

Intercepts Ball Bat's attack and flips him through a van window, incapacitating him.
Dodges multiple blows from Crowbar Man, then counters with a precise strike injuring Crowbar Man's groin, freezing him.
Prevents Machete Man from retrieving his gun, bats it away, and causes Machete Man to flee in terror.
Recovers his gun quickly and effectively pursues the fleeing opponent while neutralizing another threat with a punch.
Pursues Machete Man relentlessly despite hazards and public disturbance, showing determination.
Barrels past Latinx patrons who curse him in Spanish, ignoring their discomfort.
Chases Machete Man through multiple private and public spaces, causing chaos and putting others at risk (including crashing into a backyard with women potting plants).
Keeps up with Machete Man, a speedster, and is gaining on him despite challenging obstacles.
Navigates a chaotic urban environment including vaulting over cars, running through a grocery store, and following the exact route over fences and treacherous two-by-fours.
Catches Machete Man by the ankle on a precarious tightrope-like structure made of two-by-fours, but both crash as the structure collapses.
Says 'Gracias, muchacho' after hitting the punk in the face and then walks away.
Works intensely and impatiently at his kitchen table, showing frustration but dedication to his task.
Responds to Sara's request for comfort by saying 'Of course I will. I've been waiting to hear from Jax.' and goes to hold her.
Organizes extensive notes and evidence on a corkboard, listens to wiretap tapes carefully, revises his theories (crossing out earlier assumptions) indicating critical thinking.
Makes multiple phone calls seeking information but gets hung up on and frustrated, showing persistence despite obstacles.
Expresses frustration and impatience after unproductive calls.
Leaves the scene after hitting the punk and says a brief 'Gracias, muchacho,' then walks away calmly.
Spends time comforting Sara, showing emotional intelligence in balancing personal relationships during investigation.
Tries to keep a casual expression despite being shaken when his wife Sara notices his distress, then comforts her with a hug and a smile, downplaying the danger to avoid worrying her.
Receives a serious late-night warning from Fox and tries to keep a casual expression despite being shaken; reassures his wife to avoid raising alarm.
Immediately arms himself and takes a defensive position on hearing a loud pounding at the door late at night; promptly checks multiple windows and locations for incoming threats.
Does not explain fully to his wife the gravity of the situation, downplaying the CIA call and acting as if it is a drunken mistake.
Hands over his gun deliberately to agents instead of allowing a grab, showing control and cooperation, avoiding escalation.
Reassures Sara by telling her 'It's all right, darling' during a distressing raid, trying to comfort her.
Restrains himself from anger or violence in front of his family despite provocation, prioritizing their well-being.
Recognizes the presence of multiple law enforcement officers and calmly lowers his gun, then confidently controls the transfer of his weapon to another agent rather than allowing an unexpected grab.
Restrains his anger and aggressive impulses despite emotional and stressful circumstances involving his family and law enforcement intrusion.
Does not attempt to resist arrest or escalate conflict, instead showing controlled and deliberate behavior during a potentially volatile situation.

Maintains control and restraint despite rage, choosing not to execute all four attackers outright.

Lifts and drives a man through a glass window, showing physical strength and tactical aggression.

Reassures Sara by saying 'I am if you are' after being injured, showing concern for her well-being.
Hands suitcases to relatives, helping them depart quickly and smoothly.
Instructs Sara to start ahead by five minutes, organizing their escape efficiently for everyone’s safety.
Focuses on protecting his family and emphasizes keeping them safe ('Just stay with my family').
Does not express uncertainty or emotions openly when asked about the priest or help, remaining pragmatic and reserved.
Organizes and executes a quick family evacuation despite dangers; equips family with weapons; maintains calm focus under pressure.

Grabs another hand-carried case and hurries into the car, taking quick, decisive action to prepare for escape.

Presses the clerk for information about missing explosives, showing concern and teamwork with Neeley.
Snatches the release form and stares at the signature, stunned (reaction suggests trust but surprise; no negative tone).

Engages in candid conversation with Fox, showing some self-criticism by admitting he was 'too dumb to crack it.'

Understands the situation clearly once it is explained, showing ability to piece things together.
Needs Fox to warn him about wiretaps and to arrange an escape, indicating reliance on others for critical decisions.
Engages in calm, reflective conversation with Fox, showing some composure under pressure.
Confronts Fox about war crimes and mass murder, insisting on accountability and justice.
Expresses disgust and contempt towards Fox and the CIA agents for their crimes and impunity.
Calls out Fox on crimes and corruption with detailed knowledge and moral clarity, confronts him boldly despite danger.
Sees the gun under Fox's coat but does not back down or attempt to de-escalate, risking physical harm.
Maintains intense emotional control and uses facts strategically to challenge Fox, showing mental and rhetorical skill.
Plays it cool and tries to avoid alarming innocent bystanders despite tense confrontation.
Backs away cautiously, ready for anything but does not escalate violence.
Thanks Fox despite dangerous situation.
Plays it cool under threat, senses danger and backs away cautiously while staying ready.
Uses calm, somewhat ironic remarks in a tense hostage-like situation, indicating presence of mind.
Snatches a pistol from a dying Fox under heavy machine gun fire and immediately dives for cover behind a concrete column.
After taking cover, quickly shoots an advancing enemy agent in the head with precise aim.
Springs from cover firing and attempts to escape down a ramp despite overwhelming enemy fire.
Seizes an unsuspecting valet to commandeer a car and attempts to get away.
Tears a valet from behind the wheel of a car, commandeers it without consent.
Drives aggressively and violently, including slamming Salvano with the car causing a horrible death.
Relentlessly pursues Zagon despite being injured, prioritizing stopping a dangerous criminal.
Cuts off Zagon's car to stop him, risking personal injury in a chaotic and dangerous situation
Takes off after Zagon on foot despite personal risk, showing determination to stop a threat
Asks Zagon how he plans to kill the senator, showing engagement despite being restrained and threatened.
Does not retaliate or resist despite brutal beating and harsh treatment.
Attempts to speak calmly and asks a strategic question about the senator's movement, showing situational awareness despite being restrained and under threat.
Fails to physically resist effectively and is overwhelmed by physical violence, showing vulnerability in physical confrontation.
Meets Zagon's eyes with defiance despite being beaten and restrained.
Springs to life suddenly to save himself and attacks Zagon ferociously, showing survival instinct and aggression.
Despite being severely beaten and injected with a drug that incapacitates him, Nico maintains defiance and awareness.
Reacting instantly and violently to the injection, struggling to escape despite overwhelming force.
Springs back to life unexpectedly, catching his captors off guard and counterattacking by slamming Zagon into the wall.
Immediately evades a shotgun aimed at his face and seizes the attacker’s wrist, showing quick situational awareness and reflexes.

Sidesteps the shotgun blast, disarms the shotgun agent, uses the shotgun as a club to incapacitate the Noose agent, quickly kills Bad Dude with a double-barreled shotgun blast, frees Zagon by slashing the tapes, and swiftly disarms and defeats Zagon in close combat despite being weakened by drugs.
Inflicts brutal violence on Zagon, breaking his arm and neck causing death.
Collapses delirious and weak after violent act, enabling others to assist him.
Breaks Zagon's elbow and then neck with precise, forceful actions despite delirium, showing capability in combat skill.
Staggers delirious and collapses shortly after defeating Zagon, indicating physical or mental limits affecting his overall effectiveness.
Despite looking physically unwell, remains conscious and in full command of his faculties.
Does not visibly panic or lose composure as high-profile figures and media swarm his house.
Responds respectfully to Senator Harrison and Judge Alspaugh, shows readiness to share his story despite physical weakness, acknowledges support of others around him.
Responds confidently to Judge Alspaugh, expressing readiness to testify despite physical condition.
Maintains composure and gains respect from Senator Harrison and others present.
Pulls his gun, pops the safety, prepares to engage an enemy in a dangerous situation.
Decides not to shoot because if he does, he'll be killed later, showing calculated restraint and understanding of the situation.
Resists being pulled back but ultimately obeys Fox's urging to retreat, showing understanding of the tactical decision to disengage and survive.
Turns and flees down the jungle trail alone, leaving Fox behind as the bombing continues.
Possesses and reviews illegal bugs and tapes to gather critical evidence.
Keeps a cassette tape from the investigation and listens carefully, demonstrating his attention to detail and thoroughness.
Calmly suggests going to Salvano's for lunch after a tense situation, displaying emotional control and ability to manage stress.
Instantly pushes his family to the floor, covering them with his body to protect them from the explosion.
Swiftly checks the condition of his family members after the explosion.
Immediately takes charge after the blast, telling people to help each other move outside and to remain calm.
Remains calm and quickly assesses a dangerous ambush with multiple assailants.
Takes immediate and skillful defensive action by disarming Machete Man and using the machete effectively against another attacker, preventing a gunshot.
Allows himself to be frisked calmly, reassuring Sara that it's a mistake and it's going to be all right.
Responds to accusations with hostility, calling a superior 'asshole' and reacts aggressively by going for Halloran.
Puts his arms around Sara as she weeps, comforts her sincerely despite the tension.
Softly apologizes, expresses regret and desire to be with Sara, showing vulnerability and care.
Quietly coordinates with Lukich for a discreet escape, showing trust and consideration for safety.
Directs Lukich over the phone with specific instructions to move the stuff into the alley, not the driveway, showing foresight and tactical awareness.
Lets police cars pass by while keeping low and sprints across the street and down the alley, demonstrating situational awareness and evasive skill.
Attempts to emotionally support Sara by reassuring her despite the dire situation, showing empathy but does not exhibit direct problem-solving competence in this moment.
Shoves gun against agent's temple, orders him to strip shoes and ditch ID, uses harsh language.
Admits 'Maybe I am a lousy cop' but criticizes agency's corruption, shows frustration with system rather than individual.
Lets agent go after taking shoes and warns him to watch his step.
Moves swiftly and blends into a crowded convention center despite his police ID photo being shown on TV as a suspect.
Uses a subtle signal to communicate discreetly with a friend and arranges a meeting without drawing attention.
Fades like a shadow into the crowd after a brief interaction, avoiding detection.
Reacting instantly to a sudden attack on the priest, grabbing Lukich, and diving out the door while firing.
Shoving Lukich toward the stairwell while simultaneously firing back at enemies in a heavy gunfight.
Slamming a fresh clip into his gun under fire.
Shooting his attacker Chi Chi in the face rapidly and decisively despite emotional pain from witnessing Jackson being hit.
Attempting to fire back after being hit and running out of bullets.
Bolting for the stairwell to reload while being fired upon and clawing for a new clip as he goes.
Snatches dying comrade Fox's gun and engages in lethal firefight to protect himself and others.
Quickly takes control of an unsuspecting valet's car to escape danger.
Drives blind after windshield is shattered and front tires explode, managing to maintain control under extreme conditions.
Observes enemy's reloading and uses reverse gear to slam into the opponent, incapacitating him.
Quick to react and physically overpowers an armed adversary after exiting the car.
